intro: Rhododendron × fastigifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf rhododendron, is a hybrid shrub native to the eastern Himalayas. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with broad, leathery leaves that are often dark green in color. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated in gardens and landscapes across temperate regions.
